name: Interface Iterable<T>
text:
Implementing this interface allows an object to be the target of the enhanced
 for statement (sometimes called the "for-each loop" statement).

methods.description: Returns an iterator over elements of type T.

methods.method_sig: default void forEach (Consumer<? super T> action)
methods.description:
Performs the given action for each element of the Iterable
 until all elements have been processed or the action throws an
 exception.  Actions are performed in the order of iteration, if that
 order is specified.  Exceptions thrown by the action are relayed to the
 caller.
 
 The behavior of this method is unspecified if the action performs
 side-effects that modify the underlying source of elements, unless an
 overriding class has specified a concurrent modification policy.

Creates a Spliterator over the elements described by this
 Iterable.
